Example: For each of the values of n from 2 to 30, the following table shows the number (n − 1)! and the remainder when (n − 1)! is divided by n. (In the notation of modular arithmetic, the remainder when m is divided by n is written m mod n.) The background color is blue for prime values of n, gold for composite values. Table of factorial and its remainder modulo n n (n−1)!(n-1)! (sequence A000142 in the OEIS) (n−1)!modn(n-1)!{}n (sequence A061006 in the OEIS) 2 1 1 3 2 2 4 6 2 5 24 4 6 120 0 7 720 6 8 5040 0 9 40320 0 10 362880 0 11 3628800 10 12 39916800 0 13 479001600 12 14 6227020800 0 15 87178291200 0 16 1307674368000 0 17 20922789888000 16 18 355687428096000 0 19 6402373705728000 18 20 121645100408832000 0 21 2432902008176640000 0 22 51090942171709440000 0 23 1124000727777607680000 22 24 25852016738884976640000 0 25 620448401733239439360000 0 26 15511210043330985984000000 0 27 403291461126605635584000000 0 28 10888869450418352160768000000 0 29 304888344611713860501504000000 28 30 8841761993739701954543616000000 0
